name: gpg-bridge
description: Use Windows GPG keys via a bridge to Dev Containers, SSH, and WSL remotes. Sign git commits, verify signatures, and encrypt/decrypt files without any remote-side configuration.

virtualWorkspaces.description: GPG Bridge requires Gpg4win on a Windows host and Node.js Unix socket APIs in the remote — neither is available in virtual workspaces.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: GPG Bridge relays cryptographic operations to the Windows GPG agent — installing in an untrusted workspace could expose signing keys to a malicious workspace.
